content:
• Monday, January 22, 2018
  • CBS

    Stephens removes CBS as best idea amid Viacom re-merger talk

    • CBS (NYSE:CBS) was dropped off the best idea list at Stephens as the firm sees Shari Redstone's current push to reunite the broadcaster with Viacom (VIA, VIAB) as harmful.
    • The Tiffany Network is an attractive M&A target now, a status that would be threatened if it were part of Viacom, analyst Kyle Evans notes. And while the combo could see synergies, CBS investors would be less interested in that than in stand-alone CBS strengths, and Viacom's issues would remain unfixed.
    • He's downgraded CBS to Equal Weight and cut its price target to $64 from $72.
    • CBS shares rose 0.9% today to $58.25; VIA +0.3%; VIAB +1.7%
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 PM | 12 Comments
  • NUAN

    Nuance hits seven-month high after newsy pre-release

    • Nuance Communications (NASDAQ:NUAN) rose 9.8% today to hit its highest point since June after announcing healthy preliminary results for its quarter this morning.
    • Along with indications that it's beating consensus on top and bottom lines, the company confirmed the exit of its CEO and laid out its focus in reorganizing its mobile division.
    • With activists clamoring, Chief Executive Paul Ricci will retire on or before March 31; the company's search committee is accelerating its process, and intends to name a new chief by then. Ricci won't be nominated for election to the board at the 2018 annual meeting.
    • Meanwhile, the company plans to merge its mobile communications service provider business into its Enterprise Division to consolidate focus on telecom, and will split off the Automotive business as its own reportable segment.
    • Bob Schassler, executive VP and GM of the Mobile division has resigned from the company; the newly merged Enterprise/Mobile CSP unit will report to Robert Weideman.
    • Automobile products accounted for about 13% of the company's revenue in fiscal 2017, and that should grow by double digits in the coming year, compared with 3% for the total company, Bloomberg notes.
    • Previously: Nuance +8% on prelim Q1 results that beat prior guidance, consensus (Jan. 22 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 PM | 3 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers (1/22/2018)

  • FSLR

    First Solar, Whirlpool pop on Trump tariff news

    • First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) +6.2% after-hours following the Trump administration's approval of tariffs as high as 30% on imported solar panels, a bit lower than the 35% recommended last year by the U.S. International Trade Commission; FSLR is seen gaining from the move as costs for competing foreign panels rise.
    • The solar tariffs would last for four years and decline in increments of 5% from 30% at the start to 15% in the final year; the first 2.5 GW of imported solar cells will be exempt from the tariff.
    • Whirlpool (NYSE:WHR) also is higher, +4% as new tariffs on imported washing machines start at 20% and are imposed over three years, starting at 20% for the first 1.2M units of imported finished washers and 50% of all subsequent imports on year one.
    • Other potentially relevant tickers include SPWR, CSIQ, JKS, CAFD, SOL, RUN, VSLR, JASO, YGE, TERP, SEDG, ENPH
    • ETFs: TAN, KWT
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 93 Comments
  • OKE

    ONEOK hikes 2018 financial guidance

    • ONEOK (NYSE:OKE) +1.8% after-hours as it forecasts FY 2018 net income of $955M-$1.155B and adjusted EBITDA of $2.215B-$2.415B, nearly 20% higher than previously announced 2017 guidance, driven primarily by anticipated natural gas and natural gas liquids volume increases in the STACK and SCOOP areas and Williston and Permian basins.
    • OKE also says it continues to expect average annual dividend growth of 9%-11% through 2021 with annual dividend coverage greater than 1.2x; it expects 85%-95% of 2018 dividend payments to be a return of capital.
    • OKE sees FY 2018 adjusted EBITDA in its natural gas liquids segment of $1.3B-$1.43B, ~15% above 2017 guidance, with gathered NGLs of 850K-1M bbl/day and NGLs fractionated of 650K-725K bbl/day, up a respective 10% and 15% vs. 2017 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 13 Comments
  • FRBK

    Republic First Bancorp EPS of $0.05

    • Revenue of $21.9M (+29.2% Y/Y) misses by $0.05M.

  • AMTD

    Ameritrade up 2.4% after strong outlook

    • Alongside FQ1 GAAP EPS at an inline $0.52 and non-GAAP EPS of $0.80, the full-year fiscal 2018 non-GAAP outlook is lifted to $2.55-$3.05 thanks to the new tax law. Estimates had been for $2.71.
    • Turning back to FQ1, net new client assets up 9%; average client trades per day of 726K up 49%. Company takes note of busy activity in blockchain- and cannabis-related names.
    • Conference call tomorrow at 8:30 ET
    • Previously: TD Ameritrade GAAP EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Jan. 22)
    • AMTD +2.4% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe raises FY18 guidance; shares +1.1%

    • Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE) lifts its FY18 EPS guidance to $6.20 from the prior forecast of $5.50.
    • Adobe cites the recent U.S. tax laws since the company expects its effective tax rate to “substantially” decline. 
    • Adobe shares are up 1.1% aftermarket.  
     
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 5 Comments
  • ORAN

    Reuters: 2017 merger talks between Orange, Deutsche Telekom failed

    • Orange (NYSE:ORAN) and Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY) discussed a Franco/German merger between the two last year, Reuters reports, but the talks ended when the companies couldn't get onto equal footing.
    • "It was studied by internal teams. But people quickly came to the conclusion that nothing could be done as Deutsche Telekom is far bigger than Orange," a source tells Reuters.
    • The French and German governments hold sizable stakes in the companies respectively. Politics complicated the completion of a deal, as did a purchasing JV the two have, and overlapping business in Poland, Slovakia and Romania.
    • ORAN closed up 2.9%; OTCQX:DTEGY up 2.5% in U.S. trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMTD

    TD Ameritrade GAAP EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • TD Ameritrade (NASDAQ:AMTD): Q1 GAAP EPS of $0.52 in-line.
    • Revenue of $1.26B (+46.7% Y/Y) beats by $60M.
    • Shares +3.7%.

  • NFLX

    Netflix smashes subscriber estimates

    • Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) jumps to a new all-time high after posting Q4 numbers.
    • The company reported 1.98M domestic streaming additions vs. 1.29M consensus and 1.25M guidance.
    • International streaming additions were up to 6.36M to top the 5.05M expected by both analysts and the company.
    • Total streamings adds were 8.33M for the quarter vs. 6.34M consensus.
    • Q4 U.S. streaming contribution margin fell 140 bps Q/Q to 34.4% vs. 34.4% expected. The international contribution margin rate was 8.7% vs. 7.4% expected.
    • The company's operating margin improved 50 bps Q/Q to 7.5%.
    • Netflix on cash flow: "In Q4, free cash flow amounted to -$524 million, bringing full year 2017 FCF to -$2.0 billion, at the lower end of the -$2.0 to -$2.5 billion range we had previously indicated. This was largely due to the timing of content payments, which will now occur in 2018."
    • Netflix on content spending: "With greater than expected member growth (resulting in more revenue), we now plan to spend $7.5-$8.0 billion on content on a P&L basis in 2018."
    • Looking ahead, Netflix expects Q1 domestic streaming adds of 1.45M and international streaming additions of 4.90M.
    • Source: Netflix Q4 shareholder letter
    • Upcoming: Netflix earnings call webcast
    • NFLX +9.42% AH to $249.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 190 Comments

  • HAL

    Halliburton +6% as worst may be over for oilfield service business

    • Halliburton (HAL +6.3%) surges to its highest level in nearly a year following better than expected Q4 results and an upbeat view of the health of the U.S. oil industry given the rise in oil prices and increased drilling.
    • “I am very excited about the way 2018 is shaping up,” HAL CEO said during today’s earnings conference call. “North American unconventional activity should be very busy.”
    • HAL says it is essentially sold out in terms of its fracking fleet in a market that is short of supply, and CEO Jeff Miller noted that the company has "less equipment in the field than we did at our peak in 2014."
    • “The big takeaway is that [SLB] conveyed an unequivocally constructive outlook for the industry in 2018,” says Simmons analyst Bill Herbert, noting the company’s expectation that its North American margins will climb to ~20% this year after coming in at the mid-teens last year.
    • Guggenheim upgrades HAL to Buy from Neutral with a $75 price target, reflecting its belief that the U.S. fracking market will stay tight this year, supporting pricing, with HAL set to benefit from lower corporate taxes and the addition of new fleets of equipment.
    • HAL's strong showing gives hope that the worst is over for oilfield servicers: SLB +4.3%, NOV +2%, BHGE +2.5%, SPN +4.2%, FRAC +2%, DRQ +1.5%, FET +2.6%, OIS +1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 16 Comments
  • LOW

    Lowe's jumps to fresh all-time high

    • Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) is up 1.65% after the retailer catches the attention of two Wall Street firms today.
    • Morgan Stanley backed up its Overweight rating on Lowe's and calls the home improvement chain one of its top picks for 2018. MS thinks a lot of the tax reform savings will be funneled to shareholders.
    • Bernstein moved up two notches to an Outperform rating after having Lowe's lined up at Underperform. The PT is taken all the way up to $125 with many of prior hurdles for Lowe's now seen as cleared.
    • Lowe's hit an all-time intraday high of $107.36 earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 7 Comments
  • TECK

    Explosion at Teck's Elkview mine could hit production, analyst says

    • Teck Resources (TECK -1.4%) is lower following news late Friday that a “significant pressure event” occurred at the dryer at its Elkview coal mine in British Columbia.
    • CIBC analysts say the incident could cut Teck's 2018 metallurgical coal production by 13% to 23.7M metric tons while mining and logistics costs likely would rise by ~$1/ton and capital spending could increase by $100M.
    • Teck says Elkview continues to operate at a reduced production rate using unaffected facilities at the mine, and it is too soon to estimate the extent of any downtime or loss of production due to incident.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 1 Comment

  • MTDR

    Matador's midstream JV to partner with Plains for Delaware Basin deal

    • Matador Resources (MTDR +3.2%) is higher after announcing a new strategic partnership with Plains All American Pipeline (PAA +2.6%) to gather and transport crude oil for MTDR and other producers in the Rustler Breaks asset area in New Mexico.
    • The agreement also includes a joint tariff arrangement to offer third-party producers located within a joint development area of ~400K acres in crude oil transportation services from the wellhead to Midland, Tex., with access to other end markets, such as Cushing, Okla., and the Gulf Coast.
    • With Delaware Basin transportation costs rising, MTDR says it expects to amass "substantial" savings by transporting increasing volumes of its oil by pipeline.
    • Plains is expecting to complete a mainline extension from its current long-haul pipeline system in Texas during Q2 or Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • LTBR

    Lightbridge nearly doubles on additional U.S. patent

    • Lightbridge (LTBR +92.5%) shares skyrocket to a two-year high after saying it received a notice of allowance for patenting its metallic nuclear fuel assembly design.
    • LTBR says the decision by the U.S. patent office extends its patent portfolio coverage to its entire design for metallic fuel assemblies for Western-type pressurized water reactors, which comprise two-thirds of operating power plants worldwide.
    • LTBR also says it is finalizing a joint venture with nuclear components and reactor services company Framatome to commercialize metallic fuel for nuclear plants around the world.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 14 Comments

  • LFIN

    Longfin launches commercial ziddu smart contracts on Ethereum Blockchain; Shares +7%

    • Longfin (OTCPK:LFIN +7.3%) has announced that its Ziddu Smart Contracts are commercially available on the Ethereum blockchain.
    • Ziddu.com is an ERC 20 Ethereum-Blockchain-empowered Smart Contract provider, and it is currently the only marketplace for decentralized smart contracts.
    • Ziddu Smart Contracts are available for Trade Finance and FX markets.
    • Longfin is preparing to launch Smart Contracts for bullion financing by Q218.
    • The company has subsequent plans to make the Contracts available for peer-to-peer lending, warehouse financing, structured products, and FX/OTC derivative segments.
    • “It will take some time for the technology to develop to maturity and for the market to shake-out. In the meantime, Longfin has developed a high degree of interest and effort into the development of Smart Contracts. We see them as a critical component in distributed ledgers for pre-&-post settlements, and there is an opportunity in creating a ripe scenario for disruption.” Says Venkat Meenavalli, Chairman of Longfin.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 3 Comments
  • NVCN

    New chief at Neovasc; shares up 19%

    • Neovasc (NVCN +19%) appoints Fred Colen as President & CEO effective immediately. He succeeds Alexei Marko who will continue to serve as a board member.
    • Previously, Mr. Colen was President & CEO at BeneChill. Before that, he held senior positions at Boston Scientific.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • FOX

    Report: CBS, NBC, Fox bid for Thursday NFL games

    • This year's Thursday-night football TV rights holders CBS (CBS -0.7%) and NBC (CMCSA +0.7%) were two of the three companies to bid for Thursdays in 2018, Sports Business Daily reports.
    • They were joined only by Fox (FOX +1.8%, FOXA +1.7%) in a year expected to see a decline in the fees paid. Last week, Facebook (FB +1.6%) elected to sit out bidding for streaming rights.
    • CBS and NBC reportedly submitted bids less than they paid for 2017 (a combined $450M) after losing money on the deal this year amid waning advertiser interest.
    • Meanwhile, the programming could change homes as Fox is reported to have put in a higher-than-current bid.
    • Skipping out on Thursday NFL TV bidding: ESPN/ABC (DIS +0.4%) and (for the first time) Turner (TWX +0.2%) -- though the NFL has made it clear it won't sell Thursdays to a cable channel.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 43 Comments
  • INO

    Inovio's investigational flu vaccine shows broad protection in preclinical studies; shares up 4%

    • Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +4.2%) is up on almost double normal volume on the heels of its announcement of encouraging preclinical data on its universal flu vaccine.
    • In a range of animal models, the vaccine, a collection of synthetic DNA antigens, generated broad protective antibody responses against all major deadly strains of H1 influenza viruses from the past 100 years, including the Spanish Flu bug from 1918. The vaccine protected 100% of immunized ferrets from a lethal virus challenge.
    • The company says the DNA antigens are easy to formulate and can be developed to include seasonal vaccine changes thereby maintaining protection, adding that the immune responses were generated using its skin delivery system.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 31 Comments
  • FOX

    'Jumanji' now one of Sony's best-ever film performers

    • It was another week at the top for top box-office draw Dwayne Johnson and Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, which outgrossed another two openings to lead for the third straight week.
    • With $20M in its fifth week of release, the film becomes one of Sony's (SNE +1.2%) best-performing releases ever. It's grossed $317M domestically, passing Skyfall and making it Sony's No. 5 performer on that all-time chart. And it's drawn a worldwide total of $767.8M.
    • It topped the $16.5M grossed by war film 12 Strong (TWX +0.2%), and $15.3M from fellow newcomer (and Federal Reserve theft movie!) Den of Thieves (STX). It's also the first film not to open atop the box office to go on to top $300M (thanks to a release against Star Wars: The Last Jedi).
    • A pair of Fox releases (FOX +1.9%, FOXA +1.8%) rounded out the top five: The Post at No. 4 with $12.15M, and The Greatest Showman with $11M (hitting $113.5M cumulative).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM | 6 Comments

  • LGND

    Ligand Pharma out-licenses OmniAb platform to Ferring Pharma; shares up 3%

    • Thinly traded Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +3.2%) is up on modestly higher volume in response to its announcement that it has out-licensed its OmniAb antibody discovery platform to Ferring Pharmaceuticals.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, Ligand will receive annual platform access payments, development and regulatory milestones and tiered royalties on net commercial sales of related products. Specific financial terms are not disclosed.
    • OmniAb is a three-species (mouse, rat, chicken) transgenic animal platform consisting of four distinct technologies for producing mono- and bispecific human therapeutic antibodies.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • NYMX

    Nymox Pharma's fexapotide shows long-term benefit in men with low-grade prostate cancer; shares ahead 20%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +19.8%) is up on a healthy 28x surge in volume on the heels of its announcement of positive long-term data on lead drug fexapotide in men with low-grade localized prostate cancer.
    • Topline five-year results showed that a single 15 mg dose resulted in 80% less surgery or radiotherapy associated with cancer progression compared to control. 4.4% of fexapotide-treated patients experienced cancer progression, measured by a scale called Gleason primary pattern grade, compared to 23.5% for control (p=0.0061).
    • Fexapotide triflutate (NX-1207) is a pro-apoptotic (promotes cell death) protein administered directly into the prostate via a transrectal injection that does not require anesthesia or sedation.
    • The company's marketing application in Europe seeking approval to use fexapotide to treat men with enlarged prostates is currently under EMA review.
    • Previously: Nymox's marketing application in Europe for BPH med fexapotide triflutate accepted for review; shares ahead 8% (Sept. 14, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • SANM

    B. Riley outlines Sanmina supply chain after negative guidance

    • B. Riley looks at the supply chain after Sanmina’s (SANM -24%) negative Q1 guidance.
    • Ciena (CIEN -0.5%) (Buy rating, $27.50 price target) and Nokia (NOK +0.3%) are both customers of Sanmina and they represent large customers for Lumentum (LITE -7.6%) (Buy rating, $89 price target), Oclaro (OCLR -1%) (Buy rating, $9 price target), and Neophotonics (NPTN +4.2%) (Neutral rating, $5 price target.) 
    • Firm thinks the order push-outs within Sanmina’s Communications segment provide added evidence that CY18 Q1 will have weakness with demand starting to pick up in 2H18. 
    • Previously: Sanmina sinks on earnings, revenue warning (Jan. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 24 Comments

  • RELX

    RELX -2.5% as Morgan Stanley rates it fully valued

    • Publisher RELX (NYSE:RELX) is off 2.5% in U.S. trading as Morgan Stanley moves to Equal Weight from Overweight, pointing to a fully valued (if still high-quality) company.
    • The former Reed Elsevier is seeing greater risk than usual to its typical "4-6-8" growth formula of organic revenue, EBITA and EPS growth, MS says, due to revenue slowdowns in the areas of Scientific, Technical and Media and Risk.
    • It's cut its estimate for organic revenue growth to 3.5% for this year from 3.8%, and 3.5% for 2019 from 3.7%. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Who does it like better among its peer group now? Wolters Kluwer (OTCPK:WTKWY -0.5%), which it says has a better mix of growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • ASND

    FDA Ad Coms to meet to clarify objective of Phase 3 program for dwarfism

    • The FDA's Pediatric Advisory Committee and Endocrinologic and Metabolic Drugs Advisory Committee will meet on March 22 to discuss the objectives of a Phase 3 program for children with achondroplasia, a form of short-limbed dwarfism.
    • Related tickers: Ascendis Pharma A/S (ASND +3.7%) with lead product candidate TransCon Growth Hormone. BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN +1.4%) with achondroplasia candidate vosoritide (BMN 111).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • VZ

    Verizon up as Scotiabank joins bull camp

    • Verizon (NYSE:VZ) is up 1.6% and inching closer to its 52-week high after an upgrade to Sector Outperform by Scotiabank.
    • The firm's set a price target of $60, up from a previous $50, implying 14% upside from today's pricing.
    • Scotiabank's departing from mostly Neutral analyst sentiment on the stock; after a roller-coaster year, Verizon's share are essentially flat over the past 12 months, down just a few pennies.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 9 Comments

    FBN initiates Okta with 20% upside

    • HOTSHOT is a drinkable "sports shot" aimed at preventing and treating muscle cramps.

    Upslope Capital turns around on Crown Holdings

    | 11:18 AM
  • CNIT-OLD

    CNIT +6.8% on blockchain research plans

    • China Information Technology (NASDAQ:CNIT-OLD) shares trade up 6.8% on news the company has launched research into blockchain application.  
    • The aim is to “find a more efficient and secure solution for payment transfer, and a better mechanism to collect internal data and reward end users.”
    • CNIT expects to upgrade the accuracy of ad distribution on terminals and improve the consumer experience. 
    • Taoping Net and Taoping APP are currently used to buy and distribute real-time ads to more than 10K terminals in 10 cities in China.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • ZIOP

    ZIOPHARM riding the Celgene/Juno wave, up 22%

    • Buying has spiked in ZIOPHARM Oncology (ZIOP +22%) on the heels of Celgene's (CELG +0.1%) takeout of Juno Therapeutics (JUNO +26.9%). Shares are up on 33% higher volume.

    • Related tickers: (BLUE +10%)(CLLS +9.8%)

  • TEVA

    Jana reveals stake in Teva Pharma

    • A believer in Teva Pharmaceutical's (NYSE:TEVA) turnaround plan, Jana Partners has built a stake in the company, believing the stock to be worth $30 (50% upside), according to an investor letter.
    • Down earlier following a trial failure, Teva is ahead 1% in mid-morning action.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 13 Comments
  • BCS

    Barclays up nearly 5% on Tiger stake

    • Tiger Global is apparently a believer Jes Staley's turnaround plans for Barclays (BCS +4.4%), as the FT reports the hedge fund as having quietly amassed more than a $1B stake in the bank, making it a top-10 holder. According to a source, Tiger was a buyer of a 2.5% stake in Barclays near the lows last November.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 5 Comments
  • SRNE

    Sorrento builds on up move, shares ahead 19%

    • Sorrento Therapeutics (SRNE +18.7%) continues its upward march on more than double normal volume. Shares have tripled since early December.

    Bunge could be valued at as much as $100/share in potential ADM deal

    • Bunge (BG +2.7%) adds to Friday's last-minute surge that followed a report that Archer Daniels Midland (ADM +1.9%) sought merger talks with the company, potentially setting up a bidding war with Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF, OTCPK:GLNCY).
    • Stephens analyst Farha Aslam was surprised by news of the potential deal, since BG’s product portfolio is far more commodity-oriented vs. the value-added strategy that ADM has been articulating, but a deal could create significant synergies.
    • Credit Suisse's Robert Moskow thinks a deal would make sense strategically for ADM, as it would create significant scale in South American, European and Asian markets, and eliminate excess capacity in regions where margins have come down; he suspects ADM may be trying to get BG at the negotiating table before the standstill agreement with Glencore expires in February.
    • Citi's David Driscoll believes BG would be valued at $85-$100/share, but a deal would be less attractive if ADM is unable to hold onto BG’s North American and European crushing assets in a deal due to regulatory challenges.

  • ARRY

    Array's CRC triplet therapy continues to show positive effect in late-stage study; shares ahead 12% premarket

    • Array BioPharma (NASDAQ:ARRY) is up 12% premarket on modest volume on the heels of its announcement of updated results from a Phase 3 clinical trial, BEACON CRC, assessing the triplet combination of encorafenib, binimetinib and Eli Lilly's ERBITUX (cetuximab) in patients with BRAF-positive metastatic colorectal cancer (CRC). The data were presented at the ASCO GU Symposium in San Francisco.
    • In CRC patients with the BRAF V600E mutation, estimated median progression-free survival (PFS) was 8 months. The confirmed overall response rate (ORR) was 48%, including three complete responders. The ORR was 62% (n=10/16) in patients who received only one prior line of therapy.
    • On the safety front, the most common Grade 3 (serious) or Grade 4 (life-threatening) adverse events (AEs) (30 subjects) were fatigue (13.3%), urinary tract infection (10.0%); elevated AST (enzyme biomarker for liver damage) (10.0%) and elevated CK (enzyme biomarker for damage to the heart, muscle or kidney) (10.0%). There were two discontinuations due to treatment-related AEs.
    • Enrollment is ongoing. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated completion date is July 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 13 Comments

    • BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BCRX) and Idera Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDRA) have agreed to merge. The combined company, to be renamed at closing, will be led by Idera CEO Vincent Milano. BioCryst Chairman Robert Ingram will serve as Chairman. BioCryst CEO Jon Stonehouse will be serve as a board member.
    • Under the terms of the deal, each BioCryst share will be exchanged for 1/2 of a share of the new company stock while each Idera share will be exchanged for 1/5 of a new share. BCRX shareholders will own 51.6% of the combined organization and IDRA shareholders will own 48.4%.
